title: Songwriting Workshop with St. Lenox (Andrew Choi)
venues: Lucille Caudill Little Fine Arts Library / Niles Gallery
brief_description: Want to know more about telling stories through song? Please come to this workshop with St. Lenox (Andrew Choi).
description:
Curious About Writing Songs?

Want Feedback on Your Own Songs?

Do You Just Want to Hear More About the Process?

Then please come to a songwriter Workshopwith St. Lenox:

Telling Stories Through Song.

Singer-songwriter, Andrew Choi, is the force behind St. Lenox. He has been called a "lyricist of the highest order" and his last album was hailed as “a 21st century pop masterpiece” (PopMatters). He has released two albums and is just about to release his third entitled Ten Fables of Young Ambition and Passionate Love. Mr. Choi began singing karaoke as an outlet, and then turned to writing his own songs. In addition to receiving early training in violin at Juilliard, Mr. Choi received his Ph.D. in philosophy from Ohio State University, a law degree from NYU and is a practicing attorney in New York City.

title: Curator Tour
brief_description: Curator Janie Welker leads a tour of Ralph Eugene Meatyard: Stages for Being and discusses the influential photographer's use of locations, lighting, friends, and family
description: Curator Janie Welker leads a tour of Ralph Eugene Meatyard: Stages for Being and discusses the influential photographer's use of locations, lighting, friends, and family.

title: Artist Talk and Performance with St. Lenox
venues: Lucille Caudill Little Fine Arts Library / Niles Gallery
brief_description: Artist Talk and Performance with St. Lenox (Andrew Choi)
description:
Artist Talk with St. Lenox (Andrew Choi):

Issues of Immigration in the Visual Album 

Ten Hymns From My American Gothic

3:30pm, Niles Gallery


Performance with St. Lenox to follow at 7pm, Niles Gallery


Singer-songwriter, Andrew Choi, will discuss issues of immigration in his 2016 album Ten Hymns From My American Gothic, which was hailed as “a 21st century pop masterpiece” (PopMatters). The themes of this work were later expanded into visual concept album in June 2017 and elaborates on the aftermath of the presidential election, as well as other issues tackling a range of issues such as education, law, the immigrant experience, gun control, LGBT issues and American politics. In addition to receiving early training in violin at Juilliard, Mr. Choi received his Ph.D. in philosophy from Ohio State University, a law degree from NYU and is a practicing attorney in New York City.

title: Message Theater presents: A Raisin in the Sun
brief_description: The Lyric Theatre & Cultural Arts Center and Message Theater are proud to present Lorraine Hansberry's 1959 classic, "A Raisin in the Sun"
description:
The Lyric Theatre & Cultural Arts Center and Message Theater are proud to present Lorraine Hansberry's 1959 classic, 'A Raisin in the Sun'.


60 years since its debut in 1959, 'A Raisin in the Sun' has continued to resound with generations of fans. Its timeless story of struggle and self-identity has a poignance and gravity that has influenced countless artists and adaptations over the years, and we are proud to add our names to this list.


There are no groups better than Message Theater to present this masterpiece, and no more significant location than The Lyric Theatre's historic stage for its setting. Don't miss this one of a kind performance!


'Message Theater's mission 'is to bridge the cultural gap in the Lexington Theater Community'. Lorraine Hansberry's epic play has a timeless, resounding message for all that that bridge connects to as she masterfully touches upon dreams, motherhood, love and life. Part of our goal in the community is to provide a venue for artists to express themselves and The Lyric Theatre is the epitome of that effort. We are so proud to have local talent as performers, set builders, prop masters and wardrobe apprentices as the community experiences theater in a grand way. It is a winning package gifted for the community.' 


-Patrick Mitchell, Director, Message Theater.


Join us for three performances:


Friday, September 28 - 7:30 pm

Saturday, September 29 - 7:30 pm

Sunday, September 30 - 3:00 pm


Learn more on the groups involved:

Message Theater

https://www.facebook.com/messagetheater59/


The Lyric Theatre & Cultural Arts Center:

www.lexingtonlyric.com


Thank you to our dedicated Sponsors:

Bluegrass Community Foundation

LexArts

Kentucky Arts Council

William L. Davis: Attorney at Law

Proscan Imaging

NIA Urban Ministries

Hamilton Saykaly Garbulinska Foundation

title: Robbie Fulks / Linda Gail Lewis
brief_description: Robbie Fulks is a singer, recording artist, instrumentalist, composer, and songwriter
description: Robbie Fulks is a singer, recording artist, instrumentalist, composer, and songwriter. His most recent release, 2017’s Upland Stories, earned year’s-best recognition from NPR and Rolling Stone among many others, as well as two Grammy® nominations, for folk album and American roots song (“Alabama At Night”).

title: Kentucky Fried Zine Fest 6
brief_description: KFZ is back with another day of zines, comics and more!
description:
KFZ is back with another day of zines, comics and more! This year we have partnered with Institute 193 and UK's School of Art & Visual Studies. We are excited to bring in makers from all over the country to show their work and educate others about what they do. 


This event is FREE and open to the public. For information on becoming an exhibitor, visit www.kfzines.org


Stay tuned for information about workshops, performances and other special events.

title: 193 Sound: Charalambides, Pete Fosco
brief_description: Institute 193 and WRFL 88.1 FM Radio Free Lexington present an ongoing series of FREE experimental music performances, curated and organized by Robert Beatty
description:
Institute 193 and WRFL 88.1 FM Radio Free Lexington present an ongoing series of FREE experimental music performances, curated and organized by Robert Beatty.

For the October installment we will feature performances in the main Gallery at 21c Lexington from Texas avant garde psych folk duo Charalambides and Cincinnati guitar experimentalist Pete Fosco.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Charalambides (Houston, TX)

Charalambides founders Tom & Christina Carter follow a vision of iconoclastic music as transformative force. Touching on the outer limits of acid folk, psych rock, and improvisation, their sound remains uniquely personal & consistent. Since 1991, Charalambides has released many recordings on labels like Siltbreeze, Kranky & Wholly Other. 

https://charalambides.bandcamp.com/


Pete Fosco (Cincinnati, OH)

Pete Fosco is an experimental guitarist based in Cincinnati. His music ranges from gentle drones to improvised cacophony. 

https://petefosco.bandcamp.com/

title: The Infinity Show
brief_description: A show dedicated to our eternal search for beauty, innovation and a balanced relationship with nature
description:
'Nature is an infinite sphere of which the center is everywhere and the circumference nowhere.' -Blaise Pascal

A show dedicated to our eternal search for beauty, innovation and a balanced relationship with nature.


Bella Begley, Sandhya Raman and Soreyda Benedit Begley will showcase their collections and will set up a pop-up boutique with one of a kind, handmade pieces. Beautiful importer fabrics will be available for purchase by the yard.


Local models will walk the runway wearing the looks that go from traditional to contemporary to futuristic. Hair and makeup will be done by Paul Mitchell the School Lexington.


Models: Abigail, Linda, Jaylin, Morgan, William, Kyara, Zaynab, Elena, Briyan, Chrys, Ninda, Hena, Heidi, LaKyya, Acacia, Maggie, Emile, Kimberly, Shulin, Serena, Kieshuan & Adri.


Photographers: Tatiana Aristizabal and Joshua Mimbs.


Master of Ceremony: Lakshmi Sriraman 


For more information about the designers, models and hair & makeup team, please visit http://www.soreyda.com/


We are absolutely thrilled for the opportunity to present our artistic vision to the Lexington community, through a medium that is so dear to our hearts and we are beyond grateful to all the people that are helping us with making this happen.

title: Sergio Andres Pineda: Hands Up. Put the Money in the Bag.
brief_description: Join us for the opening of Sergio Andres Pineda's solo exhibition of photographs and paintings
description:
Join us for the opening of Sergio Andres Pineda's solo exhibition of photographs and paintings, Hands Up. Put the Money in the Bag. Check out the statement below, and come see the work in person!

--


This is the effect of Lexington, Kentucky. I've been here for four years. In this time, the essence of the city is within me. The culture, the vibe, the North Side, East Side, downtown scene, a love letter to Lexington and everyone in it, if you will. 


This is dedicated to the lady’s and gentleman that are hustling, out here steady on the grind in this city. To the night life, where we unwind. This is a toast to Lexington and the individuals that make this city pop off.


Sergio Andres Pineda

title: AthensWest Theatre Company presents The Importance of Being Earnest
brief_description: In Oscar Wilde's "serious comedy for trivial people," bachelors Algernon and Jack have both created secret identities so they can socialize discreetly in London - until true love, the frightening Lady Bracknell, and the name "Ernest" all catch up with them.
description:
AthensWest Theatre Company proudly presents Oscar Wilde's "serious comedy for trivial people." Bachelors Algernon and Jack have both created secret identities so they can socialize discreetly in London - until true love, the frightening Lady Bracknell, and the name "Ernest" all catch up with them.

title: Neighborhood Engagement in Planting and Nurturing Urban Trees
venues: Lyric Theatre and Cultural Arts Center
brief_description: Learn about the dynamics of urban trees in the community from Senior Arboricultural Officer for the Borough of Hackney, London (England), Rupert Bentley Walls.
description:
Neighborhood Engagement in Planting and Nurturing Urban Trees


Rupert Bentley Walls will give this public seminar on his experience working in London and across the United Kingdom. He is an expert in tree planting, species selection, establishment and community engagement, local authority management structures, service provision, and understands how tree officers function. A description of Rupert's talk is as follows:

'Tree and site selection are frequently the primary emphases in community tree planting initiatives, but an often overlooked aspect of these initiatives is the process of engaging residents in recipient neighborhoods. Rupert Bentley Walls has spent his career in tree planting and tree care, creating and engaging in such relationships with residents of high need neighborhoods. Senior Arboricultural Officer for the Borough of Hackney, London (England), Rupert will discuss the barriers to, and share his successes in, expanding the tree canopy and creating resident tree advocates. '


The talk will go from 7pm - 8pm, but is preceeded by an hour (6pm - 7pm) of light refreshments and exhibitors from around the Lexington-Fayette area.


This event is sponsored by UK’s Department of Community & Leadership Development and the Urban Forestry Initiative

title: Dennis Quaid and The Sharks at The Burl
brief_description: Dennis Quaid and The Sharks at The Burl for a special encore performance
description:
Dennis Quaid and The Sharks at The Burl for a special encore performance! 


MON 10.15 

DOORS: 7PM

MUSIC: 8PM


Actor Dennis Quaid and The Sharks have been performing in front of thousands of people receiving rave reviews. He is not just another actor turned rock star, he is a rock star.


​Dennis Quaid is the lead singer and rhythm guitarist. He performs many original plus classic hits such as 'Spill the Wine', 'Gloria', and many more.

The band's origins can be traced to one night when Quaid went to see actor Harry Dean Stanton and his longtime band (appropriately named the Harry Dean Stanton Band) perform at an L.A. club.


Quaid was invited to join the band onstage. At first reluctant because of his decade long layoff from music, Quaid finally did perform with the band and was successful enough that James, also a member of Stanton's band, approached Quaid about starting a group of their own.


James quickly began recruiting others for the band and it wasn't long before Dennis Quaid & the Sharks, which specializes in 'rock 'n' roll and country-soul,' was performing at L.A. clubs. The band even throws in a Jerry Lee Lewis song or two in the mix, such as 'Great Balls of Fire,' which Quaid has firsthand experience performing, having played 'The Killer' in a 1989 biopic.

Quaid said the shows are as much fun for those in attendance as they are for the band. "(The audiences) have a blast, which is all we want,' he said. 'I make a complete and utter fool of myself. I think that's the only way to have fun (onstage), instead of trying to pretend to be cool and all the rest of that stuff."

title: Panel Discussion: Meatyard as Model
brief_description: Tony Hardin, Chair of Department of Theatre & Dance; Rebecca Gayle Howell, author and poetry editor for Oxford American; and Daniel Vivian, Chair of the Department of Historic Preservation, College of Design, discuss the photographs of Ralph Eugene Meatyard from their unique perspectives. Moderated by Stuart Horodner
description:
Recital Hall, Singletary Center

FREE


Tony Hardin, Chair of Department of Theatre & Dance; Rebecca Gayle Howell, author and poetry editor for Oxford American; and Daniel Vivian, Chair of the Department of Historic Preservation, College of Design, discuss the photographs of Ralph Eugene Meatyard from their unique perspectives. Moderated by Stuart Horodner.

title: Art Talk with Claire Ashley and Jaclyn Mednicov
brief_description: "Lake Effect" artists Claire Ashley and Jaclyn Mednicov discuss their art practices, exuding with humor, wit and color.
description:
Art Talk with Claire Ashley and Jaclyn Mednicov | Thursday, Oct. 18, 6 p.m., Morlan Gallery,

followed by a closing reception from 7-8 p.m.


" Lake Effect ", facilitated by Trevor Martin '92, Executive Director of Exhibitions at the School of the Art Institute of Chicago, features a quartet of contemporary artists connected to the city of Chicago: Claire Ashley, Susanna Coffey, Jaclyn Mednicov, and Maryam Taghavi. Through painting, sculpture, installation, and video, their works celebrate color, texture, and repetition to interrogate a range of material use and form. 


Morlan Gallery, open weekdays noon-5 p.m., is in the Mitchelle Fine Arts Center, located on the historic campus of Transylvania University. Parking is close, ample, and free! All events are free and open to the public.


Special Events and Hours

Curator’s Talk with Trevor Martin |Thursday, Sept. 20, 6 p.m., Morlan Gallery

Lexington Gallery Hop Reception| Friday, Sept. 21, 5-8 p.m.

Art Talk with Claire Ashley and Jaclyn Mednicov |Thursday, Oct. 18, 6 p.m., Morlan Gallery,

followed by a reception from 7-8 p.m.

Evening Hours | Wednesday, Sept. 26, 6:30-7:30 p.m. and Tuesday, Oct. 9, 6:30-7:30 p.m.

Closed October 15, 16 for Fall Break

title: Short Plays
brief_description: We are pleased to present two newly-commissioned 20-minute plays based on Ralph Eugene Meatyard’s photographs
description:
Fri / Sept 21 / 6:30 – 8 pm

Sun / Oct 21 / 2 – 3 pm

Sat / Nov 17 / 2 – 3 pm 


FREE


We are pleased to present two newly-commissioned 20-minute plays based on Ralph Eugene Meatyard’s photographs. Each play will be performed once on each of the above dates.


HAPPY HOUSE, by Kara Lee Corthron

A house can hold just so much - furniture, folks, mysteries, memories, fire and fury - that sometimes it feels like it's about to burst. Other times, it might just - deflate. Come sit a spell and you decide about the feel of this here house.


Director: Peter Allen Stone

Stage Manager: John Thomas Priar

Cast: Harper: Katy Rucker (Freshman)

Isaiah: Carson Latham (Sophomore)

Sawyer: Maeada King (Junior)

Mother: Meredith Crutcher (local Lexington actor)




FALSE FACE, by Silas House

Jacob is a young man who has been traumatized by events both explosive and quiet. In FALSE FACE, he tells us his story--at least what he wants us to know of it--by exploring the nature of fear and the lack of nuanced thought in contemporary society. 


Director: Peter Allen Stone

Stage Manager: John Thomas Priar

Cast: Jacob: Josiah Correll (UK Theatre & Dance Graduate)

Mask 1/Mother: Maeada King (Junior)

Mask 2: Katy Rucker (Freshman)

brief_description: This original KET production explores the life and career of Kentucky’s most acclaimed writer, the only author to win a Pulitzer Prize in both fiction and poetry (two)

This original KET production explores the life and career of Kentucky’s most acclaimed writer, the only author to win a Pulitzer Prize in both fiction and poetry (two).

title: Halloween Parade and Thriller
brief_description: The Halloween Parade features floats, vehicles and some of your favorite Halloween characters some spooky and some friendly
description:
A biting wind seeps into your bones. Zombies take over the streets. The shrieks and howls of mischief-makers fill the air. Lexington Parks and Recreation and Mecca Live Studio And Gallery presents our annual Halloween Parade and Thriller reenactment on Sunday Oct. 28. 


The Halloween Parade features floats, vehicles and some of your favorite Halloween characters some spooky and some friendly. Make sure to grab a good seat on Main street because this parade starts at 8 p.m. sharp!


Thriller immediately follows the Halloween parade at 8:30 p.m. Michael and Ola will emerge from the The Kentucky Theater and zombies will quickly begin dragging behind them. This is the 17th year for this wonderful event and we can't wait to get the zombie dancing started.


In addition, to the Halloween Parade and Thriller, our 3rd annual Wicked Wonders Market kicks off at 2 p.m. in the Courthouse Plaza and will close right before the Halloween Parade at 8 p.m. Artists will be displaying their ghoulish wares designed to thrill, chill and delight. It’s a singularly bizarre bazaar, an excellently eerie venue for sellers to showcase their wares, be they wild or weird, sinister or spooky! Live music, entertainment and food trucks will be on site for this event.

title: Festival del Dia de los Muertos // Day of The Dead Festival
brief_description: Experience the rich visual, musical, dance and culinary traditions of this holiday, celebrated in Mexico and parts of Central and South America
description: Experience the rich visual, musical, dance and culinary traditions of this holiday, celebrated in Mexico and parts of Central and South America. The Festival includes live music and dance performances, traditional food, hands-on crafts, art exhibits, a candlelight parade, and an exhibition of altars in the Old Episcopal Burying Ground. FREE event, 5-9pm, for the entire family

title: Performance: veiled tender presence afar
brief_description: Inspired by the proximity and yet seemingly vast distance portrayed between the family members in Meatyard’s photographs
description: Inspired by the proximity and yet seemingly vast distance portrayed between the family members in Meatyard’s photographs, Rae Goodwin will perform for the first time with her partner, Chris Riegert, and his two sons, Evan and Griffin Riegert, on the Hindu holiday, Divali. This slow work remarks upon time, tenderness and emotional remove. Continuing Goodwin’s performance work focused on intimacy and interaction the audience will become critical in the experience of this work.

title: Joy Williams (of The Civil Wars) at The Burl
brief_description: Joy Williams is a singer-songwriter from Santa Cruz, CA who now lovingly calls Nashville, TN home
description:
Joy Williams (of The Civil Wars) at The Burl

Sunday, December 2nd 2018


ON SALE: Friday, September 7th at 10AM

SUPPORT: Anthony Da Costa 

DOORS: 7PM 

SHOW: 8PM 

21+ 



Joy Williams is a singer-songwriter from Santa Cruz, CA who now lovingly calls Nashville, TN home.


Formerly of four-time Grammy Award-winning Folk, Country and Americana duo The Civil Wars, Joy has toured with Adele and The Lumineers and collaborated with Taylor Swift, Justin Timberlake, Paramore, St. Vincent, Matt Berninger of The National, Chris Cornell of Soundgarden, Rick Rubin, Emmylou Harris, T Bone Burnett, Cameron Crowe, The Chieftainsand Birdtalker.

Joy recently recorded her forthcoming solo album, Front Porch, produced by Kenneth Pattengale of The Milk Carton Kids. Following the recent birth of her second child, Joy is slowly and steadily bringing the front porch to cities around the US and Canada in advance of the album’s imminent release in 2019.
